Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the authenticity of the photograph by implying that it shows a real solar eclipse over the ocean in the South Pacific.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image is a composite of at least two different photographs and not a genuine depiction of a solar eclipse.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove the authenticity of the photograph as a real solar eclipse.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph is genuine without considering the discrepancies pointed out by the expert.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by stating that the image is a composite of different photographs and not a real solar eclipse.
